Question: Which reading is given to one tenth of a millimetre?

A woman runs 2.0 km from X to Y in 20 minutes
and then rests at Y for 10 minutes.
She then takes 10 minutes to run 1.6 km from Y to Z.
What is the size of her average velocity for the journey from X to Z?

A cyclist travelling in a straight line at 8.0 m / s
accelerates to 12 m / s in a time of 6.0 s.
Which expression gives the cyclist’s acceleration?

The diagram shows the distance–time graph for a moving object.
What is the moving object?

Options.A: a ball thrown vertically upwards and falling back to the thrower
Options.B: a car, starting from rest, speeding up as it moves away from a traffic signal
Options.C: a rock dropped from a high cliff, falling into the sea below
Options.D: a train braking to a halt as it stops at a station

Question:
Four of the gravitational forces that act between bodies in the Solar System are listed below.
P the force on the Moon due to the Earth
Q the force on the Earth due to the Sun
R the force on the Earth due to the Moon
S the force on the Moon due to the Sun
Which two forces are a Newton’s third law pair (action and reaction)?

A parachutist of mass 60 kg falls at a steady speed of 10 m / s.
The gravitational field strength g is 10 N / kg.
What is the upward force acting on the parachutist?

A force moves a box up a rough slope.
The diagram shows four forces acting on the box.
Which is the force due to friction on the box?

The mass of object P is greater than the mass of object Q.
The objects contain different amounts of matter and have a different resistance to change of motion.
Which row is correct?

Options.A: greater amount of matter greater resistance to change of motion A P P

Question:
Four objects of different masses are situated in places with different gravitational field strengths.
Which object has the greatest weight?

A uniform metre rule is balanced by a 4.0 N weight as shown.
W 4.0 N
10 cm 50 cm 100 cm
pivot 0
What is the weight W of the metre rule?

A large hook sticks into a pencil.
The hook and pencil are balanced on the edge of a table, as shown.
Where is the centre of mass of the hook and pencil?

The diagram shows a graph of load against extension for a material.
At which point is the limit of proportionality?

A length of metal wire is made from a radioactive isotope of the metal.
The diagram shows masses suspended from the end of the wire.
The masses are removed from the wire.
Which property changes?

The diagram shows a manometer containing mercury that is sealed at one end.
h vacuum
What happens to the distance h when the manometer is taken higher up a mountain?

Options.A: It decreases, because atmospheric pressure decreases with height.
Options.B: It decreases, because atmospheric pressure increases with height.
Options.C: It increases, because atmospheric pressure decreases with height.
Options.D: It increases, because atmospheric pressure increases with height.

Question:
The pressure on the gas contained in a sealed syringe is slowly doubled.
The volume of the gas halves.
What must be true about the density and the temperature of the gas?

An object is lifted.
Which expression gives the increase in gravitational potential energy of the object?

Options.C: the rate at which work is done
Options.D: weight multiplied by the increase in height

Question:
The diagram shows a small car of mass 500 kg approaching a hill.
It moves up the hill with constant speed.
The gravitational field strength g is 10 N / kg.
Ignoring friction, how much work is done in moving the car up the hill?
Which method of producing electricity does not use an a.c. generator?

Three solar panels have a total area of 7.2 m2.
Together, they produce 1.0 kW of power.
What is the efficiency of the solar panels?

A student suggests three different definitions for power.
1 energy transferred per second
2 force x distance moved
3 rate of doing work
Which definitions are correct?
Which statement is correct?

Options.A: Infrared radiation cannot travel in a vacuum.
Options.B: Infrared radiation cannot travel in solids or in gases.
Options.C: Infrared radiation can only travel in a vacuum.
Options.D: Infrared radiation can travel in a vacuum and in gases.

Question: How is latent heat defined?

Options.A: the thermal energy absorbed or emitted by unit mass during a change of state without a temperature change
Options.B: the thermal energy absorbed or emitted by unit mass during unit temperature change
Options.C: the thermal energy absorbed or emitted during a change of state without a temperature change
Options.D: the thermal energy absorbed or emitted during unit temperature change

Question: In low-pressure hydrogen, there are no forces between the molecules except during collisions with each other. Which statement describes the motion of a molecule between one collision and the next?

Options.A: It moves with changing speed and continuously changes direction.
Options.B: It moves with changing speed in a straight line.
Options.C: It moves with constant speed and continuously changes direction.
Options.D: It moves with constant speed in a straight line.

Question: A gas is enclosed in a container of fixed volume. The gas gains heat energy from an external source. What happens to the molecules of the gas?

Options.B: They move faster inside the container.

Question: A wave on water travels towards a stationary boat. As the wave passes, the boat starts to move up and down and gains kinetic energy from the wave. Which property of the wave changes as the wave passes the boat?
Which waves are longitudinal?
An object is placed at a distance from a converging lens that is equal to twice the focal length of the lens. Which statement about the image is correct?

Options.C: It is on the same side of the lens as the object.

Question: The lens in the diagram produces an image I of the object O. Why is this not the ray diagram for a photographic enlarger?

Options.C: The lens is a converging lens.

Question: What is the approximate range of audible frequencies for a healthy human ear?
The speed of sound in air is ca, the speed of sound in water is cw and the speed of sound in ice is ci. Which relationship is correct?
One end of each of two bars is marked with an X or a Y, as shown. What materials are bar 1 and bar 2 made from?
The diagram shows a car ignition switch and starter motor. What is the explanation for the choice of wires?

Options.A: Each circuit needs to contain the same total mass of wire.
Options.B: Thicker wires heat up more quickly when the relay is switched on.
Options.D: The ignition switch circuit carries a smaller current than the starter motor circuit.

Question: The diagram shows a simple circuit. What happens when the resistance of the variable resistor is increased?

Options.A: The lamps are dimmer and the motor rotates more quickly.
Options.B: The lamps are dimmer and the motor rotates more slowly.
Options.C: The lamps have the same brightness and the motor rotates more quickly.
Options.D: The lamps have the same brightness and the motor rotates more slowly.

Question: The diagram shows a simple electrical circuit. Which statement cannot be correct?

Options.C: The p.d. V (across the resistor) is 10 V.

Question: The cable to an electric cooker contains a live wire, a neutral wire and an earth wire. When the cooker is working correctly, in which wires are the currents equal?

Options.A: the live, the neutral and the earth
Options.B: the live and the earth only
Options.C: the neutral and the earth only
Options.D: the neutral and the live only

Question: The manufacturer of an electrical heater states that only one heater must be connected to the mains wiring through any fuse. The current in the circuit with only one heater is 9 A. The fuse rating is 10 A. Despite the warning, a second identical heater is added, as shown. When the switch is closed the fuse blows. What happens when the switch is closed?

Options.A: Each heater only receives half the correct current.
Options.B: Each heater receives twice the correct current.
Options.C: The circuit wiring connecting the heaters to the mains may overheat.
Options.D: The fuse melts when the heaters are switched on.

Question: A coil is rotating in a magnetic field. The coil is connected to an oscilloscope. The diagram shows the trace on the screen of the oscilloscope. The coil now speeds up and rotates twice as fast. Which diagram shows the new trace?
A teacher uses the circuit shown. What happens to the voltage and the power supplied to lamp Y?

Options.A: the voltage supplied to lamp Y decreases, the power supplied to lamp Y decreases
Options.B: the voltage supplied to lamp Y decreases, the power supplied to lamp Y stays the same
Options.C: the voltage supplied to lamp Y increases, the power supplied to lamp Y increases
Options.D: the voltage supplied to lamp Y increases, the power supplied to lamp Y stays the same

Question: A car battery supplies a current in one direction. A current in the opposite direction recharges the battery. Which circuit recharges the battery, using an alternating current (a.c.) supply and a diode?
A proton has charge q and mass m. What is the charge and what is the mass of an alpha-particle?
